testCase.expectations:
- titles should include broad topics like "Ciência da Computação", "Programação", "Desenvolvimento de Software"
      - may include other related topics to coding and programming
      - all titles and descriptions in Brazilian Portuguese

      
  - Focus only on title field, no need to pay attention to the description
  - It's okay for description to have issues, focus on the title
  - The description should NOT have an impact on scoring unless it's written in the wrong language
  - Title should NOT have level/joiner words like "basic", "intermediate", "advanced", "fundamentals", etc
  - Title should NOT have words like "course" in the title
  - Titles are in Title Case
  - Not following title guidelines is a major error

steps.conclusion: None. The titles are in Brazilian Portuguese, use Title Case correctly with prepositions in lowercase, avoid levels and joiners, and align with the vague input by offering broad, single-topic courses. Descriptions are one sentence and in Portuguese, which is acceptable though not central to scoring.

Minor omission of expected broad titles: it does not include “Programação” or “Desenvolvimento de Software” explicitly, which were highlighted as desirable broad options. All existing titles look valid and well-formed.

Add missing broad staples like “Programação” and “Desenvolvimento de Software,” and consider a few more core single-topic options relevant to coding such as “Algoritmos,” “Estruturas de Dados,” “Banco de Dados,” “Sistemas Operacionais,” “Redes de Computadores,” “Controle de Versão com Git,” “SQL,” “Desenvolvimento Front-End,” and “Desenvolvimento Back-End.”
